info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 11:38AM CDT until June 20 at 5:41AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas...
Slate Creek At Wellington affecting Sumner and Cowley Counties.
Little Arkansas River At Alta Mills affecting Harvey and Reno Counties.
Cottonwood River near Florence affecting Marion County.
Whitewater River at Towanda affecting Butler County.
Little Arkansas River Near Halstead affecting Harvey County.
Whitewater River at Augusta affecting Cowley and Butler Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Whitewater River at Augusta.
* WHEN...From late Wednesday night to early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding of low lying areas can be expected, especially rural roads west of town approximately 1 mile.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 21.7 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING
